Hey Noah,
You are correct, it's the issue with
my file editor. TextPad is
t=
ranslating all the Japanese characters into ?. When I open the Arc file in
=
Notepad I am able to see the right data. I did not think about it since the=
 Arc
data that was loaded into my database also missing the original Japane=
se text.
In my programs, I am using org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader,
org.archi=
ve.io.arc.ARCRecord and other classes to load the records from Arc file and=
 store it
into my database. The database has UTF-8 encoding settings
but st=
ill there is an information loss.
I will investigate more on this and
let y=
ou know for further assistance.
Thanks for your help so far.
~Ravi



On Tu=
esday, December 17, 2013 10:17 PM, Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...> wrote:=

  
=C2=A0 
Arin,=C2=A0

I tried crawling that page and writing to arc, and=
 it worked fine. Is it possible the file got mangled by your text editor or=
 something? If not, maybe you can try the latest build from http://builds.a=
rchive.org/maven2/org/archive/heritrix/heritrix/3.2.0-SNAPSHOT/. If the pro=
blem persists you might want to debug it yourself since I can't seem to rep=
roduce it. 

Noah
